qas.question: When year did the Dambusters raid happen?
What did the new system designed after the Dambusters raid supposed to do?

answers.text: knock down any low-flying aircraft with a single hit

qas.question: What replaced the 50 millimeter gun that was not accurate?
What type of control system did the 55 millimeter gun use?
What was used to aim the guns after electrical commands were sent?

context: After the Dambusters raid in <a0_0>1943<a0_0/> an entirely new system was developed that was required to <a1_0>knock down any low-flying aircraft with a single hit<a1_0/>. The first attempt to produce such a system used a 50 mm gun, but this proved inaccurate and <a2_0>a new 55 mm gun<a2_0/> replaced it. The system used <a3_0>a centralised control system<a3_0/> including both search and targeting radar, which calculated the aim point for the guns after considering windage and ballistics, and then sent electrical commands to the guns, which used <a4_0>hydraulics<a4_0/> to point themselves at high speeds. Operators simply fed the guns and selected the targets. This system, modern even by today's standards, was in late development when the war ended.
